content.body: Seems reasonable; I would support it

content.body: sffc: https://github.com/boa-dev/boa/pull/2072#issuecomment-1141836914 - that makes a lot of sense to me. The "cut off from the right" for extensions makes no sense to me. Can we fine tune ECMA-402 to remove extensions first?
content.formatted_body: sffc: https://github.com/boa-dev/boa/pull/2072#issuecomment-1141836914 - that makes a lot of sense to me. The "cut off from the right" for extensions makes no sense to me. Can we fine tune ECMA-402 to remove extensions first?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: sffc: https://github.com/boa-dev/boa/pull/2072#issuecomment-1141836914 - that makes a lot of sense to me. The "cut off from the right" for extensions makes no sense to me. Can we fine tune ECMA-402 to remove extensions first?

sffc: https://github.com/boa-dev/boa/pull/2072#issuecomment-1141836914 - that makes a lot of sense to me. The "cut off from the right" for extensions makes no sense to me. Can we fine tune ECMA-402 to remove extensions first?

content.body:
> <@zbraniecki:matrix.org> sffc: https://github.com/boa-dev/boa/pull/2072#issuecomment-1141836914 - that makes a lot of sense to me. The "cut off from the right" for extensions makes no sense to me. Can we fine tune ECMA-402 to remove extensions first?

Yeah; in practice, these are currently always language identifiers, not locale identifiers, but with our work on user preferences, Unicode extensions will start to show up more, and we should be more future-proof

content.body: I recommended to them to file an issue against ecma. I'm also wondering if we should additionally document that "BestAvailable" algo has known correctness bugs - https://github.com/rxaviers/ecma402-fix-lookup-matcher
